commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Duke.java to Scribbles.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Modify template for Project Duke to Scribbles, a chatbot
with a more fun and quirky personality to differentiate
the project from other people using the same template

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove 'Duke' from documents and test case files
commitResults.messageBody: Presence of 'Duke' found in other files other than the source code itself

commitResults.messageTitle: Shift welcomeMsg & exitMsg from main() to class variables of Scribbles
commitResults.messageBody:
Move welcomeMsg & exitMsg as constant variables under Scribbles as I want the job
of main() function to control the flow and interaction of Scribbles tentatively.
Therefore, there is no need for main() to hold these 2 variables.

Side effect: The constants are accessible outside of the class due to it being 'public',
may require changes in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add in echo() in Scribbles and logic flow in main()
commitResults.messageBody:
Scribbles can interact with users by printing out whatever the
user types. When the user types 'bye' (case-insensitve), Scribbles
will terminate with an exit message.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Each object in Task have a description that describes the task

Scribbles, as a Task list manager / chatbot would be required to manage
a list of tasks, having a task class would be essential to isolate what information
and functionalities a task should have and how Scribbles interact with Task

commitResults.messageTitle: Add methods in Scribbles that interacts with Task
commitResults.messageBody:
Added addTask() and displayList() which interacts with Task directly

Scribbles allows creation of new task and storing them in a list to be displayed
when commanded with 'list'

Side note: Need to find a way to format print output for the 'horizontal lines' is getting repetitive

commitResults.messageTitle: Update logic flow for main() to interact with Task
commitResults.messageBody:
Logic flow for main() now utilises the newly added methods in Scribbles
addTask() and displayList() to perform adding task and displaying the task list
via user input

commitResults.messageTitle: Add marking feature and toString for Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Task now have a new field 'isDone' to mark and unmark task as done

toString() is added for future purposes where more details are added into Task,
e.g. deadlines, categories, etc. which all can be incorporated to how task is being
displayed on Scribbles

commitResults.messageTitle: Update displayList() in Scribbles to use toString() from Task
Add mark and unmark methods in Scribbles
commitResults.messageBody:
Scribbles have methods to mark and unmark tasks in its stored task list
as completed / incomplete.

Side note: Horizontal line printing is getting repetitive, would try to fix it
soon using echo() (currently unused) by passing output as args and
printing them that way. echo() responsibility would be to print things

commitResults.messageTitle: Update logic flow for main() for marking and unmarking task
commitResults.messageBody:
Added cases to check for keyword such as 'mark' and 'unmark' as well as
splitting user inputs into tokens to split arguments accordingly.

Splitting user inputs into tokens allow for more complicated commands
to be inputted and enables reading parameters for certain commands
such as the newly added commands like 'mark' and 'unmark'.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor horizontal line printing to echo()
commitResults.messageBody:
Most methods in Scribbles require printing to the CLI

Through this refactoring outputs will be of a consistent UI and
also removes duplicated codes, making the code cleaner and shorter

commitResults.messageTitle: Add different type of Task with change to Task to support inheritance
commitResults.messageBody:
Task comes with many categories like to dos, events, and deadline task with each tasks
having its own unique property. e.g. event tasks have 2 additional fields that specify
from what time to what time does is the event held.

Main task class have been changed to abstract to support inheritance of different types
of tasks as all tasks have certain similar properties (mark and unmark) as well as each
individual sub tasks have their unique properties. This organises the Task class as a whole
neatly while also ensuring that codes are not duplicated for each tasks

commitResults.messageTitle: Split addTask method in Scribbles to support different task types
commitResults.messageBody:
With the addition of different task types that requires different fields upon
initialisation, there is a need to change how adding tasks is handled for each
of the different tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update logic flow in main() to support different task types
commitResults.messageBody:
With the addition of different types of tasks, there is a need to handle each tasks
separately with new commands to identify the tasks that users want to add. In addition,
depending on the task that users want to add, parameters are required for these tasks.

Side note: Need to work on handling errors and exceptions to ensure parameters are
enforced for certain tasks as well

commitResults.messageTitle: Add semi-automated Text UI Testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Add input.txt that utilises all available commands for testing and ensuring
that output are showing the expected output based on EXPECTED.TXT

This helps increase efficient when it comes to testing and be can be round multiple
times as regression testing as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Custom exceptions for scribbles
commitResults.messageBody:
All custom exceptions for scribbles extends ScribblesException

Organised such a way so that any error handling specifically for scribbles
will be classified under ScribblesException

commitResults.messageTitle: Update logic flow in main() to handle different errors
commitResults.messageBody:
Handle different exceptions and throw the appropriate error message.

Error handling is important to test for cases where users might not input
a command that follows the user guide

Side note: Exception handling current is extremely messy and there is definitely
a need to refactor on. Very bug prone probably as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete functionality to Scribbles
commitResults.messageBody: Scribbles is now able to delete tasks, works similarly to marking and unmarking task

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Storage feature with task encoding
Update Scribbles to save and load from Storage
Merge branch 'branch-level-7' to 'master'
